TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit JsonExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines extension methods for various JSON.NET types that make it easier to implement a custom JsonConverter.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Advance (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader);
.method public static hidebysig void Advance(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Sub Advance (reader As JsonReader)
static member Advance : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON reader to advance.
Docs.summary: Advances the given JSON reader, or throws a JsonSerializationException if it cannot be advanced.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Expect (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, params object[] expectedValues);
.method public static hidebysig void Expect(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, valuetype Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, object[] expectedValues) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Sub Expect (reader As JsonReader, expectedToken As JsonToken, ParamArray expectedValues As Object())
static member Expect : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken * obj[] -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON reader.
The JSON token on which the reader is expected to be positioned.
Optional; The expected possible values of the current JSON token.
Docs.summary: Asserts that the given JSON reader is positioned on a token with the expected type. Optionally asserts that the value of the token matches a given expected value. If any of the assertions fail, this method throws a JsonSerializationException.

MemberSignature.Value: public static TValue Expect<TValue> (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, params object[] expectedValues);
.method public static hidebysig !!TValue Expect<TValue>(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, valuetype Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, object[] expectedValues) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function Expect(Of TValue) (reader As JsonReader, expectedToken As JsonToken, ParamArray expectedValues As Object()) As TValue
static member Expect : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken * obj[] -> 'Value

Docs.typeparam: The expected type of the value of the current JSON token.
Docs.param: The JSON reader.
The JSON token on which the reader is expected to be positioned.
Optional; The expected possible values of the current JSON token.
Docs.summary: Asserts that the given JSON reader is positioned on a token with the expected type and retrieves the value of the token, if any. Optionally asserts that the value of the token matches a given expected value. If any of the assertions fail, this method throws a JsonSerializationException.
Docs.returns: The value of the current JSON token, or default(TValue) if the current token has no value.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ExpectAndAdvance (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, params object[] expectedValues);
.method public static hidebysig void ExpectAndAdvance(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, valuetype Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, object[] expectedValues) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Sub ExpectAndAdvance (reader As JsonReader, expectedToken As JsonToken, ParamArray expectedValues As Object())
static member ExpectAndAdvance : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken * obj[] -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON reader.
The JSON token on which the reader is expected to be positioned.
Optional; The expected possible values of the current JSON token.
Docs.summary: Asserts that the given JSON reader is positioned on a token with the expected type. Optionally asserts that the value of the token matches a given expected value. If any of the assertions fail, this method throws a JsonSerializationException. Otherwise, this method attempts to advance the JSON reader to the next position.

MemberSignature.Value: public static TValue ExpectAndAdvance<TValue> (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, params object[] expectedValues);
.method public static hidebysig !!TValue ExpectAndAdvance<TValue>(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, valuetype Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken expectedToken, object[] expectedValues) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function ExpectAndAdvance(Of TValue) (reader As JsonReader, expectedToken As JsonToken, ParamArray expectedValues As Object()) As TValue
static member ExpectAndAdvance : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * Newtonsoft.Json.JsonToken * obj[] -> 'Value

Docs.typeparam: The expected type of the value of the current JSON token.
Docs.param: The JSON reader.
The JSON token on which the reader is expected to be positioned.
Optional; The expected possible values of the current JSON token.
Docs.summary: Asserts that the given JSON reader is positioned on a token with the expected type and retrieves the value of the token, if any. Optionally asserts that the value of the token matches a given expected value. If any of the assertions fail, this method throws a JsonSerializationException. Otherwise, this method attempts to advance the JSON reader to the next position.
Docs.returns: The value of the JSON token before advancing the reader, or default(TValue) if the token has no value.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsNumber (this Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken token);
.method public static hidebysig bool IsNumber(class Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken token) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function IsNumber (token As JToken) As Boolean
static member IsNumber : Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken -> bool

Docs.param: The token to check.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether or not the given JSON token is a numeric literal.
Docs.returns: true if the given JSON token represents a number, false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsString (this Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken token, string expectedValue);

<Extension()> Public Function IsString (token As JToken, expectedValue As String) As Boolean
static member IsString : Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken * string -> bool

Docs.param: The token to check.
The expected string value.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether or not the given JSON token matches the expected string.
Docs.returns: true if the given JSON token matches the expected string, false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsValid (this Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject obj, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> requiredProperties, Func<Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JProperty,bool> isPropertyValid);

.method public static hidebysig bool IsValid(class Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject obj, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> requiredProperties, class System.Func`2<class Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JProperty, bool> isPropertyValid) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function IsValid (obj As JObject, requiredProperties As IEnumerable(Of String), isPropertyValid As Func(Of JProperty, Boolean)) As Boolean
static member IsValid : Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject * seq<string> * Func<Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JProperty, bool> -> bool

Docs.param: The JSON object to validate.
The names of all JSON properties that are expected to be present in the given object.
A predicate that determines whether the name and value of given JProperty are valid.
Docs.summary: Validates the properties of the given JSON object, enforcing the presence of required properties and ignoring the order of properties.
Docs.returns: true if all properties of the given JSON object pass the given validation function and all required properties exist, false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ReadObject (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> requiredProperties, Action<Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader,string> readProperty);

.method public static hidebysig void ReadObject(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> requiredProperties, class System.Action`2<class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader, string> readProperty) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Sub ReadObject (reader As JsonReader, requiredProperties As IEnumerable(Of String), readProperty As Action(Of JsonReader, String))
static member ReadObject : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * seq<string> * Action<Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader, string> -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON reader to use to read an object.
The names of all JSON properties that are expected to be present in the parsed object.

A callback that reads a property value with the given name from the given JsonReader. It must advance the reader to the name of the next property, or the end of the object if there are no more properties to read.
Docs.summary: Reads the properties of JSON objects, enforcing the presence of required properties and ignoring the order of properties.
Docs.remarks: This method will leave the reader positioned on the end of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ReadObject (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> requiredProperties, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> optionalProperties, Action<Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader,string> readProperty);

.method public static hidebysig void ReadObject(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> requiredProperties, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> optionalProperties, class System.Action`2<class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader, string> readProperty) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Sub ReadObject (reader As JsonReader, requiredProperties As IEnumerable(Of String), optionalProperties As IEnumerable(Of String), readProperty As Action(Of JsonReader, String))
static member ReadObject : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * seq<string> * seq<string> * Action<Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader, string> -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON reader to use to read an object.
The names of all JSON properties that are expected to be present in the parsed object.
The names of JSON properties besides the required properties that may be present in the parsed object.

A callback that reads a property value with the given name from the given JsonReader. It must advance the reader to the name of the next property, or the end of the object if there are no more properties to read.
Docs.summary: Reads the properties of JSON objects, enforcing the presence of required properties and ignoring the order of properties.
Docs.remarks: This method will leave the reader positioned on the end of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ReadObjectAndAdvance (this Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> requiredProperties, Action<Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader,string> readProperty);

.method public static hidebysig void ReadObjectAndAdvance(class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader reader, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> requiredProperties, class System.Action`2<class Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader, string> readProperty) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Sub ReadObjectAndAdvance (reader As JsonReader, requiredProperties As IEnumerable(Of String), readProperty As Action(Of JsonReader, String))
static member ReadObjectAndAdvance : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader * seq<string> * Action<Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader, string> -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON reader to use to read an object.
The names of all JSON properties that are expected to be present in the parsed object.

A callback that reads a property value with the given name from the given JsonReader. It must advance the reader to the name of the next property, or the end of the object if there are no more properties to read.
Docs.summary: Reads the properties of JSON objects, enforcing the presence of required properties and ignoring the order of properties, and then advances the given reader to the next token after the end of the object.
Docs.remarks: This method will advance the reader to the next position after the end of the object.
